item.title: Claude writing a Telegram Bot, 2nd try
item.description: This is the second part of the mini series on writing Telegram bots to read my gas meter using Claude. Like in the first round, I will first show the full dialog I’ve used to let it generate the implementation. Then following up with a discussion of the code and some final thoughts. If you’ve missed the first part, and to get started on what this is all about, read this article first: Claude writing a Telegram Bot, 1st try :-)

item.title: Claude writing a Telegram Bot, 1st try
item.description: This post is the first part, in a mini series (I’m aiming for three posts in a row), where I try prompting Claude with different levels of verbosity and compare the results. Below you’ll find results of my initial try in using Claude to write a Telegram Bot. My ultimate goal is to figure out how much gas I need to heat my apartment. The gas meter is located in the hallway outside my apartment and doesn’t have a digital interface to tap into.
